00106 
00107 // This value is added to the param value for NPC-system-created events which are based on an
00108 // action rather than a fact:
00109 #define NPC_SYSTEM_EVENT_ACTION_PARAM_BONUS 10000
00110 
00111 //One Time Events
00112 //These events are scheduled to happen, and when their time is up, they are processed 
00113 //once, and deleted.  The first prototype requires the actual world time in minutes 
00114 //included the current day, and the additional ones are wrappers which calculate the 
00115 //actual world time for you.
00116 BOOLEAN AddStrategicEvent( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiMinStamp, UINT32 uiParam );
00117 BOOLEAN AddSameDayStrategicEvent( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiMinStamp, UINT32 uiParam );
00118 BOOLEAN AddFutureDayStrategicEvent( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiMinStamp, UINT32 uiParam, UINT32 uiNumDaysFromPresent );
00119 //Same but uses seconds instead of minutes.
00120 BOOLEAN AddStrategicEventUsingSeconds( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiSecondStamp, UINT32 uiParam );
00121 BOOLEAN AddSameDayStrategicEventUsingSeconds( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiSecondStamp, UINT32 uiParam );
00122 BOOLEAN AddFutureDayStrategicEventUsingSeconds( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiSecondStamp, UINT32 uiParam, UINT32 uiNumDaysFromPresent );
00123 
00124 //Ranged Events
00125 //In certain cases, you may wish to create an event that has a start time and an end 
00126 //time.  If this is used, then the execution of the event will happen once at the 
00127 //beginning of the event and once at the expiration time of the event.  A flag, 
00128 //pEvent->fEndEvent is set for the second call.  It is up to you process it 
00129 //separately.  An example use of ranged events would be for ambient sounds.  The 
00130 //start time would be called to define the sounds for use within the game.  The end 
00131 //time would be used to remove the sound from the system.
00132 BOOLEAN AddRangedStrategicEvent( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiStartMin, UINT32 uiLengthMin, UINT32 uiParam );
00133 BOOLEAN AddSameDayRangedStrategicEvent( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiStartMin, UINT32 uiLengthMin, UINT32 uiParam);
00134 BOOLEAN AddFutureDayRangedStrategicEvent( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiStartMin, UINT32 uiLengthMin, UINT32 uiParam, UINT32 uiNumDaysFromPresent );
00135 BOOLEAN AddRangedStrategicEventUsingSeconds( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiStartSeconds, UINT32 uiLengthSeconds, UINT32 uiParam );
00136 BOOLEAN AddSameDayRangedStrategicEventUsingSeconds( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiStartSeconds, UINT32 uiLengthSeconds, UINT32 uiParam);
00137 BOOLEAN AddFutureDayRangedStrategicEventUsingSeconds( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiStartSeconds, UINT32 uiLengthSeconds, UINT32 uiParam, UINT32 uiNumDaysFromPresent );
00138 
00139 //EveryDay Events
00140 //A second special case event, this event will get processed automatically at the 
00141 //same time every day.  Time of day lighting is a perfect example.  Other events 
00142 //such as checking for quests, can also be automated using this system.  NOTE:  
00143 //Only specify the time of day in minutes (don't add the actual day to this value)
00144 BOOLEAN AddEveryDayStrategicEvent( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiStartMin, UINT32 uiParam );
00145 BOOLEAN AddEveryDayStrategicEventUsingSeconds( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiStartSeconds, UINT32 uiParam );
00146 
00147 //Periodic Events
00148 //Event will get processed automatically once every X minutes.  The period is added to the current time for
00149 //the time stamp.  
00150 BOOLEAN AddPeriodStrategicEvent( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiOnceEveryXMinutes, UINT32 uiParam );
00151 BOOLEAN AddPeriodStrategicEventUsingSeconds( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiOnceEveryXSeconds, UINT32 uiParam );
00152 //Hybrids that aren't based from the current time.  They are offsetted from the current time first.
00153 BOOLEAN AddPeriodStrategicEventWithOffset( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiOnceEveryXMinutes, UINT32 uiOffsetFromCurrent, UINT32 uiParam );
00154 BOOLEAN AddPeriodStrategicEventUsingSecondsWithOffset( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiOnceEveryXSeconds, UINT32 uiOffsetFromCurrent, UINT32 uiParam );
00155 
00156 //Searches for and removes the first event matching the supplied information.  There may very well be a need
00157 //for more specific event removal, so let me know (Kris), of any support needs.  Function returns FALSE if
00158 //no events were found.
00159 BOOLEAN DeleteStrategicEvent( UINT8 ubCallbackID, UINT32 uiParam );
00160 void DeleteAllStrategicEventsOfType( UINT8 ubCallbackID );
00161 void DeleteAllStrategicEvents();
00162 
00163 #endif
